experience: You and Walter both know Elyse Field

ATS is a 70-person team that designs stunts and challenges and facilitates the safe construction and execution for the entertainment industry (film and TV). I collaborate with creative executives, line producers, and show production managers and manage a cross-functional team to bring an idea into life leading everything from ideation, construction planning and 3D artistic renderings using CAD software, building the proof of concept, to physically building and testing the mechanical apparatuses. My work has been featured and used across a variety of TV shows including Big Brother, Amazing Race, and American Ninja Warrior. Most notably, I was the project manager for American Grit, a 10 episode series over 2 months, where we designed, built, tested, and operated challenges in a jungle environment for the contestants.

I founded OnRope, an outdoor adventure consultancy providing custom outdoor programs for individuals as well as risk management and logistics consulting for commercial, film, and TV clients. We were the first and only guide service to be granted Special Use Permits to regularly guide technical climbing programs throughout Malibu Creek State Park. We scaled across e-commerce marketplaces and ultimately led programs for over 5,000 groups of individuals as well as educational institutions like Cali Camp, Curtis School, Archer School, Crossroads School, Loyola University and USC business school. We continue to work the Pepperdine University training instructors and providing trip design services.  I also consulted for Toyota Motors on behalf of Saatchi and Saatchi and produced technical outdoor  adventure content promoting 4Runner vehicles. Similarly, I partnered with Kia Motors on three separate occasions to facilitate various stunts featuring Kia vehicles. 8 letters of recommendation available upon request

Maxim Healthcare provided a network of skilled nursing professionals and medical services for hospitals and at-home patients.I leveraged my interpersonal skills to build long-term relationships with healthcare professionals across hospital systems. I marketed, trained and educated these partners about Maxim’s services - ultimately consistently exceeding quarterly sales quotas. Letter of recommendation available upon request

Fulcrum Adventures is a high-end team-building company. I facilitated and coached 2,000+ hours with groups from Microsoft, 3M, Yahoo, Boys & Girls Club, and teens involved with Culver City Police Department’s youth programs. Ultimately, I went on to lead our outdoor adventure programs where I managed our four, year-round camp facilities as well as designed and constructed new ropes course infrastructure.Letter of recommendation available upon request.

October 23, 2017, Susan was a client of Walter’s

Walter meticulously managed the entire ATS team on location for American Grit (FOX challenge show).  We had a ambitious and rigorous schedule with an even more challenging location (weather, time, terrain, remote locations, lack of nearby resources) and Walter rose to the occasion with each and every request.  He is a constant professional & outstanding strategist.  He is proficient in finding quick and efficient solutions to the many challenges presented during production and always on point with communicating needs and any change in plans.   With safety paramount on all productions, Walter always made sure his team took all safety precautions at every step.  Walter is always my first choice to call, I would highly recommend him and look forward to working  with him again on many future projects.

Nick Bernyk
Challenge Producer
October 4, 2016, Nick managed Walter directly

On American Grit, Walter ran a team building an amazing obstacle course, rigged at height into a forest of Douglas firs. It carried over and down a 30 ft cliff and this was accomplished under extreme environmental conditions and an extremely tight deadline. His ability to lead by example with clear communication and adaptability on the fly led to the project's success. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend him for any project especially due to his collaborative nature and willingness to find a positive outcome to any situation.

summary: I’m a cross-functional project manager with 10+ years of experience across various industries including adventure / outdoor recreation, entertainment, healthcare, and financial services. I combine my analytical finance background with my strong interpersonal skills to bring ideas to life.I’m passionate about how people interact with the mechanical and natural world. Specifically, I have 10+ years experience working in the outdoor recreation space - I’ve designed and constructed stunts and challenges for a variety of TV shows (American Grit, Big Brother, Amazing Race, American Ninja Warrior). I also have 7+ years experience in team-building and leadership development including leading outdoors programs for clients including Microsoft, 3M, Yahoo, and the Boys & Girls Club.I founded my own outdoors adventure startup in 2011 and completely bootstrapped the idea. We quickly became profitable after making different growth bets scaling across e-commerce marketplaces (LivingSocial). I helped us scale our finance/operations and also hired our team of five. Ultimately, we led programs for over 5,000 groups of individuals as well as clients like Toyota, Kia Motors, Aramark, and actor Jared Leto to name a fewI’m also a tech geek. I dabble in coding and am proficient CAD designer. Message me if there’s a common interest - always looking to jump on interesting projects!
name: Walter Larkins
title: Consultant | Project Manager | Entrepreneur
